Increased life expectancy: If all diseases were cured, people would live longer, healthier lives. This could lead to a significant increase in the global population and put a strain on resources.
Improved quality of life: Without the burden of disease, people would be able to live their lives to the fullest, without limitations imposed by their health conditions.
Reduced healthcare costs: With diseases cured, healthcare costs would decrease significantly, as people would no longer need treatments for chronic conditions.
Increased productivity: Healthier people would be more productive in the workforce, contributing to economic growth.
Shift in societal values: If disease is no longer a major concern, societal values may shift towards other areas, such as education, environment, and social justice.
